intro: Hieracium semistellatifrons, commonly known as the starry hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and basal rosette of leaves, which help it survive in dry, disturbed habitats. The plant produces yellow composite flowers that are arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, typical of the daisy family. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped with serrated edges, and the plant is often found in meadows and grassy areas. Hieracium semistellatifrons is a perennial species that can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
